definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Ma'am Bougon was in the habit of leaving all the doors open.
sentences.chinese: 毕尔贡妈妈经常是让那些房门敞开着的。

sentences.english: Then, sometimes, the door slowly opens and gapes _ for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 有时房门会慢慢打开，敞着不动。

sentences.english: Suddenly the kitchen door opened, and his landlady came out into the hall. "Well, well. ""
sentences.chinese: 突然厨房门打开，他的房东太太走到厅子里来。

sentences.english: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house
sentences.chinese: 你所行的道要离他远，不可就近他的房门。

sentences.english: Today, I got trapped in the kitchen due to the faulty door getting jammed.
sentences.chinese: 今天厨房门坏了，我被关在里面。

sentences.english: He drove to the tenement and knocked on Igace's door.
sentences.chinese: 他把车子开到公寓大楼，叩响伊格内斯的房门。

sentences.english: There's a Do-Not-Disturb sign on your door knob.
sentences.chinese: 你的房门上挂着“请勿打扰”牌。

sentences.english: At 1:36, she opened the kitchen door and went outside.
sentences.chinese: 在1:36时，她打开厨房门去了外面。

sentences.english: So I closed the door, " Mr. Jackson said."
sentences.chinese: 于是我关起房门，“先生杰克逊说。

sentences.english: Goldilocks ran down the stairs, opened the door, and ran away into the forest.
sentences.chinese: 金凤姑娘冲下楼梯，打开房门，逃进了盛临。

sentences.english: A guard opens the door and Maricruz enters.
sentences.chinese: 一个警卫打开了房门，Maricruz走了进来。

sentences.english: Two girls are standing at the door of my room.
sentences.chinese: 两个女孩正站在我的房门口。

sentences.english: When she walked near to the door, Lily found the door locked.
sentences.chinese: 当黎黎走近房门时，她发现门锁着。

sentences.english: With a whirl of skirts and with the brilliant sparkle still in her eyes, she Ran out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛里还噙着晶莹的泪花，裙子一摆，她奔出房门。

sentences.english: Please put the electronic card close to the sensor area of the lock, and then turn the handle to open the door.
sentences.chinese: 请将电子卡靠近门锁感应区，转动手柄即可开启房门。

sentences.english: Suddenly the kitchen door opened, and his landlady came out into the hall.
sentences.chinese: 突然厨房门打开，他的房东太太走到厅子里来。

definition: to close (a door)/to turn off (light, electrical equipment etc)
to stand as a goalkeeper/to keep guard on a gate
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
variant of 門閂|门闩[men2 shuan1]
horizontal bar to hold a door closed (made of wood or metal)/door bolt
